title_full: MIGSEC01-BP01 Understand the security credentials needed by the discovery tool
title: Understand the security credentials needed by the discovery tool
description: Discovery tools, whether AWS native or partner solutions, typically leverage agent-based or agentless discovery methodologies. Identify the least privilege model and apply accordingly. Follow the principle of least privilege, granting only the necessary permissions to discovery tools and their associated IAM roles or users.
outcome: Discovery tools configured with least privilege credentials, using credential management systems to limit sharing and proliferation.

title_full: MIGSEC01-BP02 Understand how the discovery tool works
title: Understand how the discovery tool works
description: Understand the network requirements for discovery tools. These tools use different ports and protocols to collect information. Study the documentation to understand the networking and potential security and availability considerations.
outcome: Clear understanding of discovery tool network requirements, ports, protocols, and security considerations.

title_full: MIGSEC01-BP03 Understand the discovery tool's data security and apply appropriate controls
title: Understand the discovery tool's data security and apply appropriate controls
description: Understand what data the discovery tool collects, where it is stored, and how it is encrypted in transit and at rest. Ensure this meets your organization's security policy requirements and get necessary approval from your security team.
outcome: Discovery tool data collection, storage, and encryption practices validated against organizational security policies with security team approval obtained.

title_full: MIGSEC02-BP01 Perform a tools mapping exercise
title: Perform a tools mapping exercise
description: Map your on-premise security tools and controls to those available in your AWS environment. This includes controls like identity and access management, perimeter security, encryption tools, network security, data security, vulnerability management tools, code scanning tools, and threat detection.
outcome: Comprehensive mapping of on-premises security tools to AWS equivalents, including network security, OS-level security, vulnerability management, and data security controls.

title_full: MIGSEC03-BP01 Understand, establish, and implement compliance framework
title: Understand, establish, and implement compliance framework
description: Identify your compliance requirements, determine geography-based compliance needs, and familiarize yourself with the compliance postures of AWS services. Understand the shared responsibility model and ensure AWS services align with your compliance requirements.
outcome: Identified compliance requirements with AWS service compliance postures validated and shared responsibility model understood.

title_full: MIGSEC04-BP01 Implement strong identity and least privilege principles
title: Implement strong identity and least privilege principles
description: Protect and limit the use of the AWS account root user. Assess how user identities are managed and authenticated in AWS. Implement a strong privileged access management program and controls.
outcome: Strong identity foundation with protected root user, appropriate identity provider selection, and privileged access management controls in place.

title_full: MIGSEC05-BP01 Implement AWS multi-account structure
title: Implement AWS multi-account structure
description: Understand and design AWS multi-account structure for isolation boundaries at the AWS account, VPC, business unit, and environment levels. Use of multiple accounts allows for benefits like grouping workloads based on business purpose and ownership, applying distinct security controls by environment, and limiting scope of impact from adverse events.
outcome: Multi-account structure designed and implemented following AWS best practices, with appropriate isolation boundaries and service quota considerations.

title_full: MIGSEC06-BP01 Establish secure connectivity to AWS
title: Establish secure connectivity to AWS
description: Establish secure data transmission utilizing VPNs or dedicated private connections to establish secure network connections for your migration. Use AWS Direct Connect for large bandwidth and dedicated connectivity. Use AWS PrivateLink to limit exposure between VPCs and AWS services.
outcome: Secure connectivity established between on-premises and AWS using VPN, Direct Connect, or PrivateLink as appropriate for the use case.

title_full: MIGSEC06-BP02 Establish network security controls
title: Establish network security controls
description: Enable layer 7 security with AWS WAF to protect web applications. Use VPCs and network segmentation with security groups and NACLs. Explore IDS/IPS solutions in AWS Marketplace. Identify anomalous network behavior using Amazon GuardDuty.
outcome: Network security controls implemented including WAF, VPC segmentation, security groups, NACLs, and threat detection capabilities.

title_full: MIGSEC07-BP01 Establish security controls for protecting data at rest
title: Establish security controls for protecting data at rest
description: Implement encryption for data at rest using AWS KMS or customer-managed keys. Ensure proper key management and rotation policies are in place.
outcome: Data at rest encryption implemented with proper key management and rotation policies.

title_full: MIGSEC08-BP01 Establish application layer security controls
title: Establish application layer security controls
description: Implement application layer security controls to protect applications during and after migration.
outcome: Application layer security controls established and validated before migration.

title_full: MIGSEC08-BP02 Optimize application security with AWS Application Migration Service
title: Optimize application security with AWS Application Migration Service
description: Leverage AWS Application Migration Service security features to enhance application security during migration.
outcome: AWS Application Migration Service configured with appropriate security settings for the migration.

title_full: MIGSEC09-BP01 Establish a data backup and restore strategy
title: Establish a data backup and restore strategy
description: Establish a comprehensive backup and restore strategy that meets recovery objectives and includes encryption and testing.
outcome: Data backup and restore strategy established with validated recovery capabilities.

title_full: MIGSEC09-BP02 Establish a Disaster recovery plan
title: Establish a Disaster recovery plan
description: Establish a disaster recovery plan that addresses cloud-specific scenarios and recovery objectives.
outcome: Disaster recovery plan established and tested for cloud environment.

title_full: MIGSEC10-BP01 Validate and use AWS native monitoring tools
title: Validate and use AWS native monitoring tools
description: Validate and implement AWS native monitoring tools for security event detection and logging.
outcome: AWS native monitoring tools validated and configured for security monitoring.

title_full: MIGSEC10-BP02 Explore cloud native AWS partner monitoring tools
title: Explore cloud native AWS partner monitoring tools
description: Explore and evaluate AWS partner monitoring tools that may provide additional capabilities beyond native AWS services.
outcome: Partner monitoring tools evaluated and selected based on security requirements.

title_full: MIGSEC11-BP01 Perform third-party integration due diligence
title: Perform third-party integration due diligence
description: Perform security due diligence on third-party integrations to ensure they meet security requirements and don't introduce vulnerabilities.
outcome: Third-party integrations vetted and validated against security requirements.

title_full: MIGSEC12-BP01 Understand the data security and compliance
title: Understand the data security and compliance
description: Verify data encryption and integrity during migration. Implement secure credential management following least privilege principles. Use AWS Secrets Manager to manage credentials and limit long-term credential use.
outcome: Data security and compliance validated with encryption in transit, integrity checks, and secure credential management.

title_full: MIGSEC13-BP01 Understand AWS service capabilities for event detection and investigation
title: Understand AWS service capabilities for event detection and investigation
description: Configure service and application logging aligned with GRC requirements. Analyze logs, findings, and metrics centrally using AWS Security Hub, Amazon Detective, and other tools. Automate and implement response to security events.
outcome: Comprehensive logging and monitoring configured with centralized analysis and automated response capabilities.

title_full: MIGSEC14-BP01 Understand AWS best practices for incident response
title: Understand AWS best practices for incident response
description: Develop and test an incident response plan that includes team overview, roles and responsibilities, communication plan, phases of incident response, and incident severity definitions.
outcome: Incident response plan developed, documented, and tested for cloud environment.

title_full: MIGSEC15-BP01 Protect your network resources
title: Protect your network resources
description: Create a layered networking architecture with isolation boundaries. Create centralized policies for network security using AWS Firewall Manager and AWS Network Firewall.
outcome: Layered network architecture with centralized security policies protecting compute and network resources.

title_full: MIGSEC16-BP01 Manage authentication for applications and databases
title: Manage authentication for applications and databases
description: Implement robust authentication and authorization controls for applications and databases using AWS services and best practices.
outcome: Authentication and authorization controls implemented for applications and databases.
